<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack -dd install fftw cflags="-gcc-sys" ldflags="/path/to/intel-parallel-studio/libmpi.so" %intel@19.1.1.217 ^intel-parallel-studio/tkdqsey
==> [2020-08-13-20:19:01.433541, 1686290] ChildError: ProcessError: Command exited with status 77:
    '../configure' '--prefix=/software/spackages/linux-centos8-ivybridge/intel-19.1.1.217/fftw-3.3.8-kjwdaran4sv6ponlam6od7arp54niivh' '--enable-shared' '--enable-threads' '--enable-mpi' '--enable-sse2' '--enable-avx' '--disable-avx2' '--disable-avx512' '--disable-avx-128-fma' '--disable-kcvi' '--disable-vsx' '--disable-neon' '--disable-fma'
2 errors found in build log:
     9     checking whether make supports nested variables... yes
     10    checking whether to enable maintainer-specific portions of Makefiles... no
     11    checking build system type... x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
     12    checking host system type... x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
     13    checking for gcc... /software/spack-src/develop/lib/spack/env/intel/icc
     14    checking whether the C compiler works... no
  >> 15    configure: error: in `/tmp/spack/spack-stage/spack-stage-fftw-3.3.8-kjwdaran4sv6ponlam6od7arp54niivh/spack-src/double':
  >> 16    configure: error: C compiler cannot create executables
     17    See `config.log' for more details

```
Background:
The ldflag is to resolve this issue: https://github.com/spack/spack/issues/6401
The cflag is to resolve this issue: https://github.com/FFTW/fftw3/issues/184  and https://community.intel.com/t5/Intel-C-Compiler/FFTW-compilation-issue-autoconf-for-standard-headers-fails/m-p/1146080/highlight/true#M34702

### Information on your system
OS: CentOS 8.2
Spack Version: v0.15.3

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

### Additional information

I believe the issue is due to this line:
```
13    checking for gcc... /software/spack-src/develop/lib/spack/env/intel/icc
```
I am not sure why it is not linking to the icc within the intel-parallel-studio installation. I checked the compilers.yaml and it points to the right folder.

<!-- Please upload the following files. They should be present in the stage directory of the failing build. Also upload any config.log or similar file if one exists. -->
* [spack-build-out.txt]()
* [spack-build-env.txt]()

### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [ ] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [ ] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [ ] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: Installation issue: fftw %intel@19.1.1.217 ^intel-parallel-studio@cluster.2020.1
